column1: 0BE26FA6-2175-4B90-8C5D-218E1D6AA346#appfire#2E0273A1-55B4-4C03-AE25-B7C8D00AF694#appfire#alarm.volume#appfire#100000#appfire##appfire#Alarm Volume#appfire#1#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-04-02 16:46:16.0#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-04-02 16:46:16.0#appfire#1#appfirenewline#4A2C1552-1F56-4CF9-8C9A-BDEE3E8EDA91#appfire#2E0273A1-55B4-4C03-AE25-B7C8D00AF694#appfire#alarm.queue#appfire#0#appfire#Logging Framework is Asynchronous in nature. Log Events goes to the Queue first and connectors takes the event from the queue for processing. Event Queue Type 0 - Circular Queue (RECOMMENDED) 1 - Infinite Queue with Initial Capacity and events will be wrapped in Soft References (JVM will garbage collect these soft references when it runs out of memory). 2 - Infinite Queue (NOT RECOMMENDED)#appfire#Alarm Queue Type#appfire#1#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-04-02 16:46:16.0#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-04-02 16:46:16.0#appfire#1#appfirenewline#BCC82E53-27B6-48BC-B532-DE16145A3B12#appfire#2E0273A1-55B4-4C03-AE25-B7C8D00AF694#appfire#refresh.frequency#appfire#0#appfire#Refresh Time to reload this configuration file In a production environment
column2: if you want to debug a specific component you can change the Alarm Log Levels (for specific Target like File
column3: DB etc) of that specific components. Once the configuration is refreshed new Log Events will be written to the configured Target (File
column4: DB etc). This will help to isolate and troubleshoot a production environment without shutting down the application. #appfire#Refresh Frequency#appfire#1#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-04-02 16:46:16.0#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-04-02 16:46:16.0#appfire#1
